DataElement.preferredName: Tobacco Use Average Number Cigarettes Smoked a Day Average Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the average number of cigarettes a person smokes or has smoked in a day.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tobacco Use Average Number Cigarettes Smoked a Day
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Use of tobacco in any form i.e. smoking, chewing or sniffing._A question about the average number of cigarettes an individual smoked or smokes in one day.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Use of tobacco in any form i.e. smoking, chewing or sniffing.

Concepts.definition: Use of tobacco in any form, e.g., smoking, chewing or sniffing.

Property.preferredName: Average Number Cigarettes Smoked a Day
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about the average number of cigarettes an individual smoked or smokes in one day.

Concepts.longName: Average Number Cigarettes Smoked a Day
Concepts.definition: A question about the average number of cigarettes an individual smoked or smokes in one day.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: C-TUQ:Cancer Patient Tobacco Use Questionnaire. NCI-AACR Cancer Patient Tobacco Use Assessment Task Force, 6/19/2015
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DCP-specific CDE based on C-TUQ Measure. 4/18/17   ST

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to the average numeric count of something.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The central tendency of a set of n numbers; lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.
Determining the number or amount of something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: On average when you have smok
ReferenceDocuments.description: On average when you have smoked, about how many cigarettes do you (or did you) smoke a day? (A pack usually has 20 cigarettes in it).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Use Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: DCP-specific CDE. Use CDE 5285992 if you are using the full NCI-AACR C-TUQ: Cancer Patient Tobacco Use Questionnaire.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: On average, when you smoked, about how many cigarettes do you (or did you) smoke a day? (A pack usually has 20 cigarettes in it).     _____ Number of cigarettes per day

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Enter a whole number (i.e. "4") only.  Do not enter a range or fraction.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: On average when you have smoked, about how many cigarettes do you (or did you) smoke a day? (A pack usually has 20 cigarettes in it).  (Number of cigarettes per day)

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-3
ReferenceDocuments.description: On average when you smoked, about how many cigarettes do you (or did you) smoke a day?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-4
ReferenceDocuments.description: On average when you have smoked, about how many cigarettes do you (or did you) smoke a day? (A pack usually has 20 cigarettes in it).   ______ Number of cigarettes per day

ReferenceDocuments.name: AMC Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: How many cigarettes on average do you smoke per day?

ReferenceDocuments.name: AMC Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the times that this individual smoked, how many cigarettes did s/he usually smoke per day?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-5
ReferenceDocuments.description: On average, when you smoked, about how many cigarettes do you (or did you) smoke a day? (A pack usually has 20 cigarettes in it).

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-TEXT-6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Approximate number of cigarettes smoked per day since the previous visit
